header_summary: Brandon Black expresses gratitude for a fix and updates the specification for a feature by replacing "OP_0 as pubkey" with the taproot internal key. They also mention carefully considering hash contents for each mode and include a table at the end. Ruben Somsen raises concerns about the transmission of invalid transactions or blocks, arguing that relying on trusted entities instead of validating is unsafe and goes against consensus. Alice provides a note inspired by Chris Belcher's post, discussing various covenant proposals in the Bitcoin ecosystem, highlighting the benefits of CTV and the concept of UASF. Vincenzo Palazzo seeks feedback on lnprototest and invites involvement from other implementations. David A. Harding expresses gratitude for work on multiparty channel design and raises concerns about the practicality of certain aspects. GamedevAlice discusses the relationship between probability and anonymity, raising questions about attacks and the vulnerability of individuals.

recent_posts.title: BIP-119 UASF

recent_posts.title: Nucleus: Capital-efficient multipeer Lightning payment channels
recent_posts.summary:

recent_posts.title: Backing up channel state with counterparties
recent_posts.summary:

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains will not reveal sensitive information.
- The musig2 protocol involves key and nonce aggregation to generate the final signature.
- Party 1 remains blinded throughout the process, ensuring privacy and security.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- Ark is a new second-layer protocol design that is an alternative to the Lightning network.
- It uses virtual UTXOs and does not require opening and closing channels for transactions.
- Ark enables off-chain payments through an intermediary called the Ark Service Provider.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Based on block size and block time, annual growth of blockchain storage is 210.24GB.
- 5TB hard drive costs less than $150 and lasts 21 years before running out of space.
- Ongoing optimization efforts and affordable hardware make blockchain storage sufficient for practical usage.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard proposes organizing the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- The announcement is made in advance due to potential complexities in organizing the summit.
- Antoine invites objections or feedback and suggests surveying suitable countries for hosting the summit.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new type of channel funding transaction with extra spending path.
- The roles in the channel are asymmetric, with Alice as the client and Bob as the server.
- The proposal includes fraud proofs, saving bandwidth, and alternative options without OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We are proceeding with the plan to conduct a "dry run" of HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking.
- The plan includes collecting forwarding data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing local reputation algorithms.
- Privacy is a priority, and node operators are encouraged to participate in data collection.
